sections.title: Take Control of Everyday Spending
sections.subtitle: Build a flexible system that keeps recurring and impulse costs in check

sections.title: Today's Focus
items: Audit your current daily spending patterns
Separate fixed, flexible, and impulse categories
Apply practical frameworks to curb leaks
Create a daily spending playbook you can keep using

sections.title: Clarify How Money Leaves
sections.content: Daily expenses creep in through convenience purchases, subscriptions, and auto-renewals. Seeing every dollar in context is the first step to controlling it. Start by listing everything you buy in a typical week and highlight the purchases that happen without much thought.

points.title: Fixed Essentials
points.description: Housing, utilities, groceries—non-negotiable costs that keep life running.

points.title: Flexible Choices
points.description: Dining out, ride-share, coffee runs—spending that can be optimized with intention.

points.title: Impulse Extras
points.description: Streaming add-ons, in-app upgrades, late-night orders—charges triggered by mood rather than plan.

sections.title: Visibility Creates Choice
sections.content: You can only improve what you measure. A 10-minute weekly review makes the rest of the month easier.

sections.title: Frameworks for Smarter Spending
sections.content: Set guardrails for flexible categories using approaches like the 50/30/20 rule or envelope budgeting. Digital banking apps allow you to create sub-accounts labeled by spending purpose. Each transfer becomes a mini decision that keeps emotions out of the equation.

sections.title: Create Your Daily Spending Playbook
steps: Export or gather the last 14 days of transactions (bank, card, or app).
Tag every expense as essential, flexible, or impulse—be honest with yourself.
Set a weekly dollar cap for flexible spending and schedule automatic transfers into a dedicated sub-account or prepaid card.
Choose one trigger habit to reduce (for example, limit delivery apps to weekends) and note the replacement action.
Schedule a 10-minute Friday review to track totals and reset for the next week.

sections.title: Automation Advantage
sections.content: Use push notifications for specific merchants so you feel the cost in real time instead of at billing cycle end.
